DataElement.preferredName: Patient Congenital Abnormality Long QT Interval Exclusion Criteria Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The yes/no/not applicable coded response regarding whether the patient was born with an abnormality of long time interval between the start of the Q wave and the end of the T wave in the cardiac cycle that would preclude participation in a clinical trial.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Congenital Abnormality Long QT Interval Exclusion Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the elements of a patient's medical history which would prevent an individual from participating in a specific clinical trial that is an abnormality of long time interval between the start of the Q wave and the end of the T wave in the cardiac cycle.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Congenital Abnormality Long QT Interval Exclusion Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: Any abnormality, anatomical or biochemical, evident at birth or during the neonatal period.:Of relatively great or greater than average spatial extension or temporal duration.:Time interval between the start of the Q wave and the end of the T wave in the cardiac cycle.:Elements of a personal medical history which would prevent an individual from participating in a specific clinical trial.

Concepts.definition: Any abnormality, anatomical or biochemical, evident at birth or during the neonatal period.
Of relatively great or greater than average spatial extension or temporal duration.
The time interval between the start of the Q wave and the end of the T wave in the cardiac cycle.
Elements of a personal medical history which would prevent an individual from participating in a specific clinical trial.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

DataElementConcept.origin: NCCTG CRF:North Central Cancer Treatment Group Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable._The affirmative response to a question or activity._The non-affirmative response to a question._Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Does patient have congenital
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have congenital long QT syndrome?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have any history of congenital long QT syndrome?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have congenital long QT syndrome or family history of long QT syndrome?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have Congenital or family history of long or short QT syndrome, Brugada syndrome, known history of QTc prolongation or Torsades de Pointes within 12 months of entering the study?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have known congenital long QT syndrome?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 01
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have personal or family history of congenital long QT syndrome?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have congenital QT prolongation?
